home.testimonialsSubtitle: Hear from developers and founders who launched their AI startups with DaTools.

testimonials.quote: DaTools has made the journey from idea to product simpler than ever before. Its comprehensive templates, scripts, and foundational infrastructure mean I hardly need to spend time on basic development. I highly recommend it to founders looking to quickly launch their SaaS businesses.
testimonials.author: Author of AITDK

testimonials.quote: DaTools made it super easy to set up payments and handle all the nuts and bolts of commercialization, so we could stay laser-focused on building features that matter. If you're looking to ship and scale your AI SaaS fast, DaTools is a no-brainer!
testimonials.author: Scar

testimonials.quote: I used DaTools and launched a new website in 8 minutes, including login/payment, so amazing!
testimonials.author: Lafe

home.faqSubtitle: Have another question? Contact us on Discord or by email.

faqs.question: What exactly is DaTools and how does it work?
faqs.answer: DaTools is a comprehensive NextJS boilerplate designed specifically for building AI SaaS startups. It provides ready-to-use templates, infrastructure setup, and deployment tools that help you launch your AI business in hours instead of days.

faqs.question: Do I need advanced technical skills to use DaTools?
faqs.answer: While basic programming knowledge is helpful, DaTools is designed to be developer-friendly. Our templates and documentation make it easy to get started, even if you're not an expert in AI or cloud infrastructure.

faqs.question: What types of AI SaaS can I build with DaTools?
faqs.answer: DaTools supports a wide range of AI applications, from content generation to data analysis tools. Our templates cover popular use cases like AI chatbots, content generators, image processing apps, and more.

faqs.question: How long does it typically take to launch with DaTools?
faqs.answer: With DaTools, you can have a working prototype in hours and a production-ready application in hours. Our one-click deployment and pre-configured infrastructure significantly reduce the traditional months-long development cycle.

faqs.question: What's included in the DaTools infrastructure?
faqs.answer: DaTools provides a complete infrastructure stack including authentication, database setup, API integration, payment processing, and scalable cloud deployment. Everything is pre-configured following industry best practices.

faqs.question: Can I customize the templates to match my brand?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! All DaTools templates are fully customizable. You can modify the design, features, and functionality to match your brand identity and specific business requirements while maintaining the robust underlying infrastructure.

home.finalCtaTitle: Ship your first AI SaaS Startup
home.finalCtaSubtitle: Start from here, ship with DaTools.

homeFeed.heading: Data Analysis Tools
homeFeed.filterHint: Filter quickly by name, tags, pricing, or deployment

tools.name: Tableau
tools.summary: Drag-and-drop BI for interactive dashboards; connects to databases, spreadsheets, and clouds with Prep, Desktop/Cloud analysis, and Server/Cloud sharing.

tools.name: Power BI
tools.summary: Microsoft self-service BI suite with Power Query prep, DAX modeling, interactive dashboards, and broad data connectors; tightly integrated with the Microsoft stack.

tools.name: Looker
tools.summary: Google Cloud semantic layer and BI platform using LookML to model metrics; supports governed dashboards and embedded analytics.

tools.name: Qlik
tools.summary: Qlik Sense with associative in-memory engine for self-service analytics and visualization plus data integration via Qlik Cloud Data Integration.

tools.name: Metabase
tools.summary: Open-source BI and visualization with SQL/GUI querying, dashboards, and embedding; easy to self-host with broad database support.

tools.name: Superset
tools.summary: Apache open-source BI with SQL Lab, visualization plugins, dashboards, and permissions; great for self-hosted and cloud-native deploys.

tools.name: Redash
tools.summary: SQL-first lightweight BI connecting many sources, with parameterized queries, visuals, dashboards, schedules, and alerts.

tools.name: Klipfolio
tools.summary: KPI dashboard and monitoring tool with drag-and-drop builder, rich SaaS/database/API connectors, refresh, and alerts.

tools.name: Mode
tools.summary: Analyst-friendly BI combining SQL, Python/R notebooks, and visualizations for collaboration and sharing.

tools.name: Sigma
tools.summary: Spreadsheet-like cloud BI with warehouse-native compute for business self-service analytics and live metrics.

tools.name: ThoughtSpot
tools.summary: Search-driven analytics with AI suggestions, embedding, and granular security for business users.

tools.name: Looker Studio
tools.summary: Google‚Äôs free dashboarding tool (ex-Data Studio) with rich connectors, sharing, and embeds for lightweight reporting.

tools.name: Lightdash
tools.summary: Open-source BI for dbt, providing Looker-style explores and dashboards from dbt models; self-hosted or cloud.

tools.name: Amplitude
tools.summary: Product analytics platform with event tracking, funnels, retention, cohorts, and experiments for growth insights.

tools.name: Mixpanel
tools.summary: Event-based product analytics with funnels, retention, cohorts, and signal analysis for optimization and growth.

tools.name: Heap
tools.summary: Autocapture product analytics; no-code event collection with funnels, retention, and pathing for fast insights.

tools.name: PostHog
tools.summary: Open-source product analytics with events, funnels, retention, session replay, feature flags, and A/B tests; self-hostable.

tools.name: Pendo
tools.summary: Product experience and analytics with in-app guides, feedback, and behavior insights to drive adoption and retention.

tools.name: FullStory
tools.summary: Digital experience analytics with session replay, journey insights, funnels, retention, and alerts for UX issues.

tools.name: June
tools.summary: SaaS product metrics dashboards and reports on top of event data: funnels, retention, activation, and growth KPIs.

tools.name: LogRocket
tools.summary: Front-end monitoring and product experience analytics combining session replay, performance, and behavior insights.

tools.name: Smartlook
tools.summary: Experience and behavior analytics with session replay, funnels, heatmaps, and event tracking to find UX and conversion issues.

tools.name: Fivetran
tools.summary: Fully managed ELT pipelines syncing databases/SaaS/events to warehouses with scheduling, incrementals, and monitoring.

tools.name: Airbyte
tools.summary: Open-source ELT connector platform with community connectors, incremental sync, and self-hosted or cloud options.

tools.name: Stitch
tools.summary: Lightweight cloud ELT (Talend) with popular connectors and scheduling to load data into warehouses.

tools.name: Hevo
tools.summary: No-code data pipeline/ELT for real-time and batch sync from many sources to warehouses/lakes with monitoring.

tools.name: Matillion
tools.summary: ELT/ETL for cloud warehouses with visual orchestration, transforms, and scheduling for Snowflake/BigQuery/Redshift, etc.

tools.name: Segment
tools.summary: CDP and event pipeline routing multi-platform data to warehouses and downstream tools with identity resolution and audiences.

tools.name: RudderStack
tools.summary: Open-source CDP/event pipeline compatible with Segment API; self-hosted or cloud to route events to warehouses and SaaS.

tools.name: N8n
tools.summary: Open-source low-code automation/integration with visual workflows, webhooks, and rich nodes; self-hostable.

tools.name: Tray.io
tools.summary: Low-code iPaaS with visual integration and automation for business/engineering teams to orchestrate APIs and events.

tools.name: Workato
tools.summary: Enterprise iPaaS/automation with triggers, workflows, data sync, and governance for cross-department integrations.

tools.name: Zapier
tools.summary: No-code automation for business users connecting thousands of SaaS apps with trigger-based multi-step workflows.

tools.name: Snowflake
tools.summary: Cloud-native data warehouse with storage-compute separation, auto scaling, sharing, and strong governance.

tools.name: BigQuery
tools.summary: Google's serverless cloud warehouse with storage/compute separation, federated queries, and BI Engine acceleration.

tools.name: Redshift
tools.summary: AWS cloud warehouse with Spectrum federation and RA3 storage/compute separation, PostgreSQL-compatible.

tools.name: Databricks
tools.summary: Lakehouse platform with Delta Lake, Spark, MLflow, and SQL warehouse; unifies data and AI workloads.

tools.name: ClickHouse
tools.summary: Open-source columnar database for real-time/near-real-time analytics with self-hosted and cloud options.

tools.name: DuckDB
tools.summary: Open-source embedded columnar database for local/embedded analytics with vectorized SQL execution.

tools.name: MotherDuck
tools.summary: DuckDB-backed cloud collaboration and storage, enabling shared, persisted, and hybrid queries.

tools.name: Firebolt
tools.summary: Cloud-native MPP warehouse focused on high-performance queries with indexing and storage optimizations.

tools.name: Hex
tools.summary: Collaborative notebook for data teams combining SQL, Python, and visualizations with easy sharing and apps.

tools.name: Observable
tools.summary: Browser-based notebook and visualization platform using JavaScript/Observable syntax for interactive data stories.

tools.name: Deepnote

tools.name: Jupyter / VS Code

tools.name: Polynote

tools.name: Optimizely
tools.summary: Mature experimentation and personalization platform with A/B, multivariate, feature flags, and objective management.

tools.name: VWO
tools.summary: Optimization and experimentation suite offering A/B, multivariate tests, heatmaps, session recordings, and conversion insights.

tools.name: AB Tasty
tools.summary: Digital experience optimization with A/B testing, personalization, feature flags, and behavioral insights.

tools.name: Statsig
tools.summary: Product experimentation and feature management with stats engine, feature flags, metrics, and fast rollback.

tools.name: GrowthBook
tools.summary: Open-source/cloud A/B testing and feature flags with self-hosting option, metric definitions, and multi-language SDKs.

tools.name: Convert
tools.summary: Privacy-focused A/B testing and personalization with visual editing, server-side experiments, and GDPR compliance.

tools.name: Split.io

tools.name: Monte Carlo

tools.name: Castor

tools.name: Prefect

pricing.faqSubtitle: Have more questions? We're happy to help

faqs.question: What's the difference between Free and Paid plans?
faqs.answer: Free lets you browse the directory with basic search and filters. Paid plans unlock traffic and other advanced data (third‚Äëparty estimates, for reference only; some sites may have no data).

faqs.question: What payment options do you support?
faqs.answer: We support monthly and yearly subscriptions (auto‚Äërenew, cancel anytime) and may also offer one‚Äëtime purchases depending on the plan. See the checkout page for details.

faqs.question: How do I cancel my subscription?
faqs.answer: You can cancel auto‚Äërenewal in the Membership Center. After cancellation, you‚Äôll keep access until the end of the current billing period.

faqs.question: Where does the traffic number come from? Is it accurate?
faqs.answer: Traffic is an estimate from third‚Äëparty data sources and may be inaccurate or unavailable for some sites. It does not represent a site‚Äôs first‚Äëparty analytics.

faqs.question: Does it include technical support?
faqs.answer: Paid plans include email support. Response times depend on current workload.

faqs.question: Do you offer refunds?
faqs.answer: Digital services typically do not include automatic refunds. If you were charged in error or cannot access paid features due to a technical issue, contact support@datools.org and we‚Äôll review and help.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of yearly billing?
faqs.answer: Yearly billing offers 20% discount compared to monthly billing, saving you more money while reducing billing frequency for convenience.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quickly find the answers you need

faqs.question: Where does the traffic number come from? Is it accurate?
faqs.answer: Traffic is an estimate from third‚Äëparty data sources. It may be inaccurate or unavailable for some sites and does not represent a site‚Äôs first‚Äëparty analytics.

faqs.question: Why do some sites show no traffic data?
faqs.answer: Some domains may have insufficient coverage in third‚Äëparty datasets or may be blocked/unsupported, so no estimate is returned.

faqs.question: What do I get with Pro?
faqs.answer: Pro unlocks traffic estimates and higher usage limits. The free plan lets you browse the directory with basic search and filters.

faqs.question: How do I cancel my subscription?
faqs.answer: You can cancel auto‚Äërenewal in the Membership Center. After cancellation, you‚Äôll keep access until the end of the current billing period.

faqs.question: Do you offer refunds?
faqs.answer: Digital services typically do not include automatic refunds. If you were charged in error or cannot access paid features due to a technical issue, contact support@datools.org and we‚Äôll review and help.

faqs.question: How can I get support?
faqs.answer: Email us at support@datools.org. Response times depend on current workload.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Your privacy matters
privacy.description: Learn how we collect, use, and protect your personal information.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: Welcome to DaTools, the **NextJS Boilerplate** designed to help you build AI SaaS startups quickly and efficiently. At DaTools, your privacy is of utmost importance to us, and this privacy policy outlines how we collect, use, and protect your personal information when you use our services.

informationCollection.title: Information Collection and Use
informationCollection.subtitle: We collect the following types of data to provide you with a better experience while using DaTools:

accountInfo.title: Account Information
accountInfo.whatWeCollect: What We Collect: This includes your name, email address, and any other information you provide when creating an account.
accountInfo.purpose: Purpose: To manage your account and provide customer support.

usageDetails.title: Usage Details
usageDetails.whatWeCollect: What We Collect: Information about how you use DaTools, including your interactions, features accessed, and usage frequency.
usageDetails.purpose: Purpose: To analyze user engagement and improve our services.

deviceInfo.title: Device Information
deviceInfo.whatWeCollect: What We Collect: Data regarding the devices you use to access DaTools, such as device type, operating system, and browser type.
deviceInfo.purpose: Purpose: To optimize our services for different devices and ensure compatibility.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.whatWeCollect: What We Collect: Small data files placed on your device that help us track user preferences and improve user experience.
cookies.purpose: Purpose: To enhance the functionality of our services and personalize your experience.

paymentInfo.title: Payment and Billing Information
paymentInfo.whatWeCollect: What We Collect: Information regarding your payment methods, such as credit card number, billing address, and any details required for transaction processing.
paymentInfo.purpose: Purpose: To facilitate billing and payment processing for our services.

dataStorage.title: Data Storage and Security
dataStorage.content: We take the security of your personal information seriously. The data we collect is stored securely on our servers, and we implement a variety of security measures including encryption and access controls to protect against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction of your personal information. However, please be aware that no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

informationSharing.title: Information Sharing and Disclosure
informationSharing.content: We do not sell, trade, or otherwise transfer your personal information to outside parties, except in the following circumstances:
circumstances: To comply with legal obligations or respond to lawful requests from public authorities.
To protect our rights, property, or safety, or that of our users or others.
To provide services through trusted third-party partners who assist us in operating our website or conducting our business, subject to confidentiality agreements.

policyChanges.title: Changes to This Policy
policyChanges.content: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new policy on this page and updating the effective date at the top of this policy. You are advised to review this privacy policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this privacy policy are effective when they are posted on this page.

contactUs.title: Contact Us
contactUs.content: If you have any questions or concerns about this privacy policy or our data practices, please contact us at:

consent.content: By using DaTools, you consent to our privacy policy and agree to its terms. Thank you for trusting us with your information!

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: Our terms and conditions
terms.description: Read our terms of service and understand your rights and responsibilities.

introduction.title: Introduction and Acceptance of Terms
introduction.content: Welcome to **DaTools**. DaTools is a directory for discovering and comparing data tools. By accessing or using our service, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree with any of these terms, please do not use our service.

serviceUse.title: Use of the Service
serviceUse.content: DaTools provides a tools directory, search and filtering, and reference information powered by third‚Äëparty sources. You agree to use the service in accordance with all applicable laws and to make your own judgment about third‚Äëparty information.

userAccounts.title: User Accounts and Registration
userAccounts.content: To access certain features of the service, you need to create an account. You must provide accurate and complete information during the registration process. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities that occur under your account. You agree to notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of your account or any other breach of security.

intellectualProperty.title: Content and Intellectual Property Rights
intellectualProperty.content: All content provided through DaTools, including but not limited to templates, code, infrastructure setup, and documentation, is protected under copyright law. The copyright owner of DaTools is **datools.ai**.
points: You acknowledge that you do not own the underlying technology or intellectual property that makes up the DaTools service, and you agree to respect the intellectual property rights of datools.ai and any third parties.
While you retain ownership of your custom implementations and modifications, the core DaTools platform and templates remain the property of datools.ai.

prohibitedActivities.title: Prohibited Activities
prohibitedActivities.content: You agree not to engage in any of the following prohibited activities while using DaTools:
activities: Unauthorized access to or distribution of our proprietary code and templates
Reselling or redistributing DaTools templates without authorization
Interfering with or disrupting the security or performance of the service
Using the service for any illegal or unauthorized purpose
Attempting to bypass any security features of the service

privacyData.title: Privacy and Data Collection
privacyData.content: DaTools collects the following types of data:
dataTypes: Account Information: Information you provide when creating an account
Usage Details: Data related to your activity on our service
Device Information: Information about the device you use to access our service
Cookies: Data that helps us enhance your experience with our service
Payment and Billing Information: Data necessary to process payments
privacyData.privacyPolicy: For more details on data collection practices, please refer to our separate Privacy Policy.

pricingPayments.title: Pricing and Payments
points: Subscriptions renew automatically until canceled; you can cancel auto‚Äërenewal in the Membership Center and keep access until the end of the billing period
Digital services typically do not include automatic refunds; if you were charged in error or cannot access paid features due to a technical issue, contact support@datools.org
Prices are subject to change with notice to users
You agree to pay all charges associated with your selected plan
Payment terms are based on your selected payment method and plan

termination.title: Termination
termination.content: We reserve the right to terminate or suspend your access to the service at our sole discretion, without notice, for conduct that we believe violates these Terms or is harmful to other users of the service, us, or third parties.

warranties.title: Disclaimer of Warranties
warranties.content: The service is provided on an as is and as available basis. We make no warranties or representations about the accuracy, reliability, or availability of the service and disclaim all warranties to the fullest extent permitted by law. Information shown on the site (including traffic and other metrics) may be sourced from public information or third‚Äëparty estimates and may be inaccurate or unavailable. Third‚Äëparty names and trademarks belong to their respective owners; DaTools is not affiliated with or endorsed by any third‚Äëparty provider unless explicitly stated.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.content: To the fullest extent permitted by law, datools.ai shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising from the use of or inability to use the service.

indemnification.title: Indemnification
indemnification.content: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless datools.ai, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, and expenses (including attorneys' fees) arising from your use of the service or violation of these Terms.

governingLaw.title: Governing Law and Dispute Resolution
governingLaw.content: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction in which datools.ai operates, without regard to its conflict of law provisions. Any disputes arising from these Terms or the service will be resolved through binding arbitration in accordance with applicable laws.

changes.title: Changes to These Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right to update or modify these Terms at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting on our website. Your continued use of the service after any changes signifies your acceptance of the new terms.

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.content: If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact us at support@datools.org.

acknowledgment.content: By using DaTools, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. Thank you for choosing DaTools!

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.subtitle: How we use cookies
cookies.description: Understand how we use cookies and similar technologies on our platform.

introduction.title: What are Cookies
introduction.content: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and to provide information to website owners.

howWeUseCookies.title: How We Use Cookies
howWeUseCookies.subtitle: We use cookies to improve your browsing experience, analyze website traffic, and personalize content and advertisements.

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.description: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be switched off. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms.

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.description: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously.

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.description: These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalization. They may be set by us or by third parties.

marketing.title: Marketing Cookies
marketing.description: These cookies are used to track visitors across websites. The intention is to display ads that are relevant and engaging.

cookieTypes.title: Types of Cookies We Use
cookieTypes.subtitle: Learn more about the different types of cookies we use

sessionCookies.title: Session Cookies
sessionCookies.description: These are temporary cookies that are deleted when you close your browser. They are used to maintain your session state while browsing the website.

persistentCookies.title: Persistent Cookies
persistentCookies.description: These cookies remain on your device for a longer period until they expire or are deleted. They remember your preferences to provide a better experience on your next visit.

firstPartyCookies.title: First-Party Cookies
firstPartyCookies.description: These cookies are set directly by us and are used to improve website functionality and user experience.

thirdPartyCookies.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdPartyCookies.description: These cookies are set by other websites, typically for advertising and analytics purposes.

manageCookies.title: Manage Your Cookie Preferences
manageCookies.subtitle: You can control the types of cookies we use
manageCookies.description: You can manage cookies through your browser settings or our cookie preference center. Please note that disabling certain cookies may affect website functionality.

browserSettings.title: Browser Settings
browserSettings.description: Most browsers allow you to control cookies. You can find cookie options in your browser's settings or preferences.
instructions: Chrome: Settings > Privacy and security > Cookies and other site data
Firefox: Options > Privacy & Security > Cookies and Site Data
Safari: Preferences > Privacy > Cookies and website data
Edge: Settings > Cookies and site permissions

optOut.title: Opt Out
optOut.description: You can opt out of certain third-party cookies, particularly those used for advertising purposes.

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.content: We retain cookie data for different periods depending on the type and purpose of the cookie. Session cookies are deleted immediately when you close your browser, while persistent cookies may be retained for months to years depending on their purpose.

updates.title: Policy Updates
updates.content: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page and, where appropriate, notified to you by other means. We recommend that you review this policy periodically to be aware of any updates.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about this Cookie Policy or need more information, please contact us at:

consent.content: By continuing to use our website, you consent to our use of cookies in accordance with this Cookie Policy.
